65 million Americans and hundreds of thousands of Oregon residents rely on Social Security to make ends meet.  With the rising cost of living, it is more important than ever to ensure that the Social Security Trust Fund can pay 100% of benefits for beneficiaries for decades. https://t.co/i4gnaSOcDU

It would ensure the future  of Social Security for another 75 years by requiring millionaires and billionaires pay their fair share into the program. This greatly improves the long term economic security of our nation’s current and future seniors. https://t.co/wk5Xo3ePlY

This important legislation increases and safeguards Social Security benefits, including  increased cost-of-living adjustments that better account for the real cost of healthcare and prescription drug prices. It would increase monthly benefits for most recipients by $200/month. https://t.co/kdfYa0OHil

Last week I, along with my friend and colleague @BernieSanders introduced the Social Security Expansion Act (SSEA). The SSEA would protect and strengthen Social Security for today’s seniors and future recipients. https://t.co/i63KqZ3at8

Gun violence is a national epidemic. That’s why I strongly support and proudly voted for the Protecting Our Children Act. While more work must be done, passage of this bill by Congress is a critical step towards addressing the horrors of mass shootings in America. #EndGunViolence

They were innocent children at school. I am devestated and enraged. Today marks the 27th school shooting and the 212th mass shooting this year alone. The Senate must take action now on the House-passed bipartisan gun safety legislation that would help save lives.

The Bureau of Labor Statistics recently released  a report showing that our economy is roaring back to life since the initial COVID-19  recession. With demand from consumers increasing employers are looking for new hires in every industry. https://t.co/hBGmW02hyP https://t.co/uTNRWl66kU

The victory of the Amazon Labor Union in Long Island is incredible and I applaud their dedication and hard work fighting for fair wages and benefits. There is a renewed interest in labor activism among U.S. workers and it is clear we are entering a new era for working people!

It’s time to make history and elect the first ever woman to represent Oregon’s Fourth Congressional District and Val Hoyle is the clear choice. I encourage you to support Val Hoyle in her history-making run for Congress! Let’s do this! @ValHoyle https://t.co/bT5lpAgUOr

Val represented the West Eugene area in the OR state legislature where she served as House Majority Leader for two years, and for the last four years she has been Oregon’s Labor Commissioner. Val knows how to get the job done, and she won’t back down in the face of adversity. https://t.co/7vzlDKefa1

My friend Val Hoyle has spent the last 20 years making Oregon her home and fighting for Oregon values; minimum wage. paid family leave, labor rights, environmental justice, and working families. https://t.co/7vzlDKefa1
March is Women’s History Month, and I can’t think of a better time to highlight a woman that I think has the potential to make history. https://t.co/8lLtWW4hq1

A significant way that we can reduce Putin’s power is to reduce the world’s dependence on Russian oil exports. 60% of their exports are oil/gas which directly funds their military machine. Our reliance on oil/gas fuels climate change and the drumbeat of war. https://t.co/Ez4urRtfqi

Cooler heads must prevail. It is imperative that we work with our international partners to bring this crisis to a peaceful resolution as soon as possible. Our thoughts are with the people of Ukraine at this difficult hour. https://t.co/jdRjpnUvyJ

This includes involvement of U.S. troops, advisers, trainers, special forces, or any other U.S. military personnel in Ukraine. The people, through their reps in Congress, must have a say before we even think about putting American lives in harm’s way. https://t.co/U5bPwg5uuO

I also reiterate that the President must first receive authorization from Congress before involving any U.S. military personnel in areas of imminent or active hostilities – as required by the Constitution and U.S. law. https://t.co/Z8nzd7HDaa
I also encourage President Biden to keep all diplomatic options on the table as the situation progresses and we continue to react. https://t.co/nEERTZL4vr

I will continue to closely monitor the conflict and work with the Biden administration and my colleagues in Congress on an appropriate course of action to address this crisis and hold Putin accountable for his reckless actions. https://t.co/8Q7MQW3xvc https://t.co/apxdwn2GFH

Russia’s cruel dictator, Vladimir Putin, is a violent thug who is putting his delusions of grandeur ahead of the millions of Ukrainian and Russian lives he is now uprooting and putting in danger. https://t.co/DdmoCKtMhq
I strongly condemn Russia’s unprovoked invasion of Ukraine, and I join with the rest of the international community in calling on Russian forces to immediately withdraw from Ukraine.
